result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwan D Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Straight time.
Credit for ZERO days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

No contact with the victim, Brenda B.
No contact with the co-actor, Drewveon Portis.
Comply with the standard rules of probation.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antwan D Green

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant Antwan D Green in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, straight time. 
Credit for ZERO days time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 year under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* No contact with the victim, Brenda B.
* No contact with the co-actor, Drewveon Portis.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges  - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given. 

FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Antwan D Green in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Antwan D Green IN CUSTODY.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to Receiving Stolen Property as a Party to a Crime [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec.  943.34, 939.05.

NO AMENDED INFORMATION FILED.

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant pled GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 01-23-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

*Conditions of bail/bond release remain the same.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Antwan D Green in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Antwan D Green in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Final Pretrial Conference held.
Parties remain in a trial posture.
There are no trial issues at this time.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11-10-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court, defendant Antwan D Green not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 10-14-2014 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 11-10-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Antwan D Green in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Antwan D Green in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Final Pretrial Conference held.
Parties remain in a trial posture and there are no trial issues at this time.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 08-06-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Richard E Thomey in court, defendant Antwan D Green not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard E Thomey in court, defendant Antwan D Green not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense is awaiting discovery.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-16-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 4-2-2014 received and filed. (10 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Richard Thomey 6650 W State Street, D-305 Wauwatosa, WI  53213

Defendant Antwan D Green in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Antwan D Green in custody.  Joann Hardtke for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Travis Capelle-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Keon P., Brandon D. and Drewveon Portis (co-defendant).

Defendant Antwan D Green in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Antwan D Green in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Antwan D Green
Current: 5062 N 54th St, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 03-25-2014)
Prior: 4847 North 58th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
